caption: The food was amazing. There was a bit of a mix up with our order due to a shift change but the manager came out right away and fixed it. Extremely kind and great staff.  The only thing I didn't like was the French toast is $20 for one piece. It was good, but $20 is far too expensive for a slice of French toast. Other than that the ambiance was great, the back patio is a must to sit in.
Cozy spot with great good food and service. Had the moqueca with mushrooms and I highly recommend it.

Tonight I had the pleasure of attending Movie Night at Santo Brúcklin. It was such a treat!The tables are properly spaced and the film ( Sidewalls 2011) was projected on a massive wall. It was such an enjoyable experience; the food was fantastic and the staff attentive.  If you have a yearning to catch a movie with an enjoyable meal, Santo Brúklin, on their Tuesday Movie Night, is a must. Reservations encouraged.

Do not recommend. Saw an outdoor comedy show here the other night and the establishment failed to work out an arrangement with the restaurant next door who was playing really loud 80s music the entire show. The comedians were annoyed by this, the entire audience was annoyed by this, and it ruined the whole show. I ordered the Seafood Moqueca and although tasty it had 4 shrimps, 3 muscles, and 3 bits of scallops for $25 - not worth it.
Super cute atmosphere with absolutely DOPE food! The PDQ is absolutely heavenly!
Had a great experience in this spot with my son. The food comes quick and the service is just excellent. Prices are reasonable.

Hands down one of the best Brazilian restaurants in NYC.The service is incredible me and my family come here all the time. The owner the bartender everyone is just amazing. Keep up the great work! 🇧🇷😎👏🏽
Brazil. Known for their rainforest and losing to Germany that one time. And I guess corruption? And also steak. Order the steak. ❤️
Delicious food and drinks. The owners are very friendly.
Just have to this is amazing. I'll post pictures and a better review later when I go again.🤤

Came here for movie night! It was an amazing experience.The ambiance, service, drinks, food, and the film were all amazing. Highly recommend the burger and chicken sandwich. I’ll definitely be back for another movie night, its so unique to find a restaurant that does this, especially during covid. Keep it up Santo! 👏🏽👏🏽👏🏽
Amazing outdoor dining space, great service, better menu.
Their “Hell Yeah! PDQ” is too good.
The place is small and quaint very attentive staff. Owner is great came over to table to greet.
Cute place! The food was yummy! The staff was nice and efficient. The environment was clean.
Friendly, professional team running an operation with a genuine experience.
Great good and outstanding service

Excellent service! Super friendly and very kind attention by waiters. Especially our brazilian waiter- Naima! I went there for the 1st time with my kids. We were really empressed, and even little surprised, by their kindness and attention they gave us. Place is cozy with warm environment. Food is pretty good, but little pricy for us...I had a their burger. It was pretty good.

What a nice night I had at Santo Bruklin! The ambiance was relaxing and suave, the staff was incredibly nice and the food was phenomenal. I had a Caipirinha and Pao de Queijo to start. Both were wonderful. The Nduja on the side of the PDQ was particularly awesome. Next I had the Moqueca with mushrooms. As a 95% vegan (**see appetizer order) I appreciated their vegan options and they absolutely knocked it out of the park. I never knew mushrooms could be cooked so perfectly! Highly recommend this spot.
Awesome food menu, great drinks, and a fantastic staff! Must try their burger!
Amazing addition to the list of Brazilian restaurants in NYC. Beautiful outdoor space and attentive staff. Photo is of the picanha steak and eggs.
Wow this is really good

Great food and warm staff. The backyard is cozy and the food transports well to eat at home. The pan de queijo is great comfort appetizer, and the different mains I tried were tasty and very well executed by the kitchen.
Good
Great place for a nice intimate dinner. Definitely will go again
Great food and fast and friendly service.
Absolutely love it

Such a welcome addition to the neighborhood. The team at Santo wis great. They were friendly from minute one, and helpful throughout our whole meal.  Our food highlights have to be their moqueca (seafood stew), chicken wings, and PDQ (cheese bread). Their take on the PDQ was new and fun, and I’ve never had a moqueca that I liked more than the one at Santo.  Happy to be able to add this place to our rotation of places we love.
Great new spot for brunch or dinner in Carroll Gardens. We felt very comfortable dining at their socially distanced covered patio. The PDQ bread and chicken and waffles are a must for brunch!
Safe outdoor dining! Covered patio, heated, tables spaced out apart, great vibes!
Great outdoor dining option with great food and cocktails to boot! The staff was super helpful and friendly. I got the steak and eggs which was cooked perfectly and tasted great.
Great food on their back patio with great service

Happened upon Santo by chance on a Sunday walk and the menu enticed us in. It honestly made our day! The picanha steak and eggs were perfect and the Sunday stew was incredible! Everything was great even down to the little cheese breads we ordered with guava and homemade cream cheese! This will be a go to for us. The staff and owners make every attempt to keep you cozy and welcomed. Thanks Santo!

OMG, I had the best time in Santo Brúklin! They were really kind and accommodated my reservation for a bigger group for my birthday celebration! The food was delicious, the caipirinha is fantastic, the space is very cozy, and the staff is lovely! I tried the PDQ, moqueca, and their cheesecake; everything was AMAZING! Definitely worth a visit!

I love this place so much! I went for the first time this weekend for brunch with a friend and it was fantastic. We had a reservation for their patio space which is very nicely decorated (the owner/manager let us know that they'll be adding an awning next month which will be clutch for the winter) and the menu had us both wanting to try everything!  We ended up going with the "best french toast you've ever had" (it was very good!), PDQs (which were AMAZING) and the bottomless mimosa special ($25 for two hours + an entree which is a great deal IMO) and let me say we left full and happy! The waiter was very nice and very generous with the mimosas, the server explained everything on the plate, the manager came to speak to us and see how the food was and we felt very welcomed!  I usually don't ever write reviews for places, but this place really earned it! Lol I didn't even take any pictures of the food because we were too excited to eat, but best believe everything was looking and tasting great. I will definitely be going back and I'm excited to try other dishes/cocktails on the menu. 10/10 would recommend!

Great experience yesterday at Santo Bruklin. The restaurant immediately had a great vibe and you can tell the ingredients and food was of the highest quality - lot of love was put into it. We came with a couple of friend and and were really impressed by the Pao De Quiejo, Fried Chicken Sandwhich, Picahna, and the Moqueqa(both vegan and seafood).  I appreciate that the menu isn't overly expansive, but instead they focused on creating the items they chose and mastered them. Drinks were also very solid and the owner surprised us with a free shot, which incredibly generous of them. Will be back for the Feijoada Sunday.  The environment was beautifully laid out inside and out with a real homey vibe. The backyard is spacious and well lit. Added bonus of having some Brazilian music play reminded me of being outdoors at a Sao Paulo restaurant/bar.  Everyone was incredibly nice, helpful and patient. Look forward to returning more often and would love to see this place at full capacity on a summer night when we're over this era of COVID.  Minor suggestion: I would love to see them add perhaps one or two more additional vegan options in the future once they are ready(no rush - quality over quantity) to provide additional options there for vegan diners such as my wife(Brazilian) and family.
We visited on Friday night and loved the vibe in the garden. The menu is short and easily navigable. The staff was down to earth and the food was just as Brazilian should be: hearty and comforting.
Amazing service. Great food.
Brazilian? This is not. Plus, they made a mistake in bringing the bill. I'm sorry but N
All stars. Do yourself a favor and have a good time here. Solid drink menu, liquor on point, unique menu and good people.

Really nice service, great shaded outdoor patio seating. Pao de queijo was really good and authentic, but damn it was $10 for two (worth it). The egg Benedict with pao de queijo was so good! Their potatoes are also 🔥

We had a great dinner here ain the beautiful big back yard. The PDQ and the seafood stew we're out of this world good. We plan to be back soon for a little birthday party. Amazing drinks as well. And they do movie nights during the week. Try it soon!
Good food, a little pricey

Food is good (even tho the vegan Feijoada does not taste like feijoada but more like a really good beans soup) and the employees are very thoughtful. The only thing is that they charged me for a little bit of extra flour and rice that I asked since they served too much Feijoada e too less sides. The “farofa” doesn’t taste like farofa at all, it’s just flour with salt that they charged 3$+ for it and SIX DOLAR for 3 spoons of white rice.
(Translated by Google) Great Feijoada and Caipirinha 👌  (Original) Great Feijoada and Caipirinha 👌

OMG I have gone there for brunch since we have been able to dine in their back yard. It is so cute back there. The brunch food and the bottomless mimosas are amazing. I've had the eggs PDQ benedict, the Chicken and Waffles and also Feijoads black bean stew (which is only made on Sundays and can be made vegan) and everything is pretty life changing.  I've also had dinner one time and the burger I got was fantastic!!! It's $25 and worth every penny!!! It's the best mixture of different meats that is sourced by a butcher  from around the neighborhood of Carol Garden. And made the way you like it. I like my burger mostly rare and it did not disappoint. That chef knows how to cook. The chicken sandwich was also amazing. Crispy out side and super juicy on the inside. Topped with a made in-house pickles and a spicy aioli.  I knew when we were able to eat at the restaurant, it would be a very different experience then just delivered.  The service was also very amazing!!! The owners come out and ask how the food was. And are we having a good time. And, as for the bottomless mimosas, they are not kidding. There are three different types. Ascii, grapefruit and regular orange mimosas.  You need to run not walk and make a reservation because it's limited table and it fillls up pretty quickly. I think this place will change your life as well. I love it here.
Food and Service were great! Will Def be back 😁 French toast was amaze as a dessert!!!!

I can see why this place has a full 5 star review. Made last minute reservations so there was only sidewalk seating left. I made a note on my resy requesting that if someone cancel we be switched to backyard since it was our anniversary celebration. Within minutes someone called me to confirm they were able to switch us and we were greated with two glasses of champagne upon arrival!!!! Backyard was safely spaced out, all staff were in masks and gloves, server was sweet and efficient. Just overall a great experience!

Usually I ignore the ads that pop up on Instagram, but this time I found a gem! I've been to Snato Bruklin three times now and each time has been better than the next. The minute you step foot into the restaurant; your greeted with warm smiles. The backyard is very charming and a great spot for a date or hanging with friends. The menu is small, but brilliant. Great food, drinks and hospitality. I couldn't ask for more. I recommend the steak, the seafood stew and the cheeesssyyyy bread. OMG, the cheesy bread. On Thursdays, the cheesy bread become a delightful sandwich---each Thursday has a different type of sandwich. When I went it was seared tuna.. so yummy. I will continue to support Santo Bruklin!
Have had both brunch and dinner here, and both are absolutely delicious. The backyard patio is lovely too. One of our fav new places!
Açaí bowl is to die for! As a good Brazilian, I didn’t resist and also tried their Caipirinha do Santo, it’s safe to say that it’s the best in town! I’ll definitely go back!
Best Brazilian restaurant in NYC - Caipirinha do santo is a must if you want to taste a great Capirinha! I am a burguer fan, so I had the Rio Good Burger at Santo and I totally recommend!
Great cocktails and food with a lovely backyard.

Service was great and drinks were tasty and surprisingly strong. I preferred the grapefruit mimosa over the açaí flavor. The caipirinha packs a punch, be careful. I liked the eggs, potato wedges, salad and cheese bread. However, the steak was a bit overcooked and had too much fat on it. I think it was bland and needed more seasoning. It was also a very small portion for the price and I expected better steak from a Brazilian restaurant. It should have been the star of my dish. Other than that, everything else was fine and I would probably return.

The waiters are super attentive and very helpful explaining menu items. The drinks are well mixed and they don't hold back on the liquor. It was happy hour.  The food was delicious. You can't find a better (BRAZILIAN) restaurant anywhere close by.  We will return very soon.
The Picanha steak and Moqueca were amazing and ambiance and drink menu were solid. Really enjoy authentic family-owned restaurant like this
Delicious Brazilian food, and great cocktails! Nice outdoor patio in the back. Will definitely return!
This restaurant is nice and roomy, the food was yummy and the prices were very fair. quick, efficient service and very welcoming staff members. Highly recommended.
Must try
The food is super duper delicious, the backyard is a lovely place to eat, and the service was wonderful!
A Perfect experience! The environment it’s so cozy, outside sitting playing Brazilian bossa nova, good drinks, amaaaaazing food and service! I will definitely come back!

This site is my preferable restaurant.  Of all restaurants I know I love it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to visit this restaurant. everytime  I want to go to a good lunch, this place comes instantly to my mind. extremely good and varied  food and a rich menu.generous team, and good ambience. Not less important, the tariff is modest. I tell about this spot with no hesitation.
Definitely a place worth visiting, the food is good and well prepared, the pricing is fair and it is consistently neat there. Great work.
Really good Brazilian food. They added a very good twist to the Pao de queijo which is a must try. Had a really nice outdoor backyard which is great for outdoor eating.
This place is amazing and spacious, the menu was delightful and the rates were very fair. rapidly, effective service and very attentive staff members. I highly recommend this place.
Great place with great food and very friendly staff. Delicious Brazilian table with fried chicken or picanha!  I just wish they had more pão de queijo! :)
Great food. Great customer service.
Yes a very cute homely brunch spot. Great food and great staff too.

Went here for an early brunch with my fiancé. Food and service were great! We went when they opened at 11 and sat in the backyard area. Ordered the Eggs Benedict and Burger - both delicious! I need to know what you guys put on the salad because that dressing is amazing. I’ll be back to try some different menu items!
Delicious, pleasant, loved it ❤️
Incredible food, and incredible service. DEFINITELY get the PDQ!
The first meal I ate in a restaurant in three and a half months. Delicious, friendly and a lovely back terrace for socially distanced dining.

Owners, backyard space, and food are amazing. They opened 1 day before the pandemic hit and just re-opened and it’s my new favorite place in Brooklyn. The vice, food, and company cannot be beat. This is my first review I’ve ever left on Google in 10 years. This place is a hidden gem that won’t be hidden for too much longer.

Excellent Brazilian food.  Perfect delivery.  Calabrese sausage and onions, Picanha Brazilian Table and Fried chicken sandwich.  All unusual, great tasting, Brazilian!   Motivated and responsible people.  This is an awesome place (just had delivery but can't wait to be there in person).
Quick delivery and the food was still hot! Some food doesn't hold up to delivery well, but theirs did. One of the better fried chicken sandwiches I've had! Really flavorful!

The best Caiprinha Ive had in NYC, by a mile. It can be a hard drink to find. Everything on the menu is really well priced.  Pedro, the owner (hey dude, do you check these?) was incredibly friendly and gave us a tote bag and a shot of top shelf Leblon Cachaca.  They opened at the dawn of Covid-19 so please support them while we figure this sh** out, and we can all drink cachaca together when it's over.

Did a pick up order of this new spot. Hadn’t heard of it before but wanted to support new places in the neighborhood and it was a huge hit. Fish stew and chicken sandwich were great. Kid devoured black beans. Good prices.

You can tell the people who work here love what they do! Such great energy inside, even during this crisis. I love that they have so many vegan options! Cant wait to see the full menu once they open for real.
Delicious moqueca, a Brazilian must have! And they serve the best vegan brigadeiro I've ever tried. Perfect taste and texture. Can't wait to have it again!
Delicious Brazilian food, a great new addition to the neighborhood. The wings were crispy and tasty, the seafood moqueca is authentic. Loved it and can’t wait to try the dine-in.
Food made with love and not just a little, lots of it! It is definitely a place to go to feed your soul :)
Great food, great people . Hope all Go back to normal so we can visit more . Brazilian kitchen with a twist . And the drinks aahhh the drinks ;)

Great brazilian food and nice drinks for a very fare price! One of New York's new gems! The caipirinha rules. Besides opening during Corona situation, they are able not only to deliver an amazing service but also donate as many meals as they can for health workers around NY and people who live on the streets. A new business that besides all the current struggle is still able to help aginst all odds deserves some recognition and our help to grow! Heads up for the staff thats always smiley, show such good work and make us fell hugged in times like this. All best for you guys!!

Amazing Brazilian food! Santo Brúklin warmed our hearts—and bellies—in these hard quarantine times. So nice to get a taste of home right here in Brooklyn. We got the delicious Moqueca de peixe e camarão (Brazilian fish and shrimp stew) and Canja de Galinha (Brazilian chicken soup). It arrived quickly and tasted incredible: The vegan brigadeiros are also a gem and don’t forget to try their caipirinha ;)
The food is wonderful and they deliver caipirinha during the quarantine! I Love!
Food was 10! Service was 11  Go for the boozy brazilian cocktails with wings!  I ordered through Caviar that delivered here in Bushwick 🙏

A wonderful little gem in the neighborhood. Santo Bruklin is my new go-to spot for soulful comfort food. I had the seafood Moqueca and the caipirinha pouch. The perfect match of warm comfort food with and a cocktail with a kick that I just loved. Looking forward to spending my summer happy hours here!
